sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"上升，举起"之意。
means: arise ：书面用词，多用于诗歌或比喻中，具有特殊的修辞色彩。
rise ：普通用词，指具体的或抽象的事物由低向高移动。
raise ：及物动词，常用词，多指把某物从低处升到高处，有时作引申用。
lift ：语气比raise强，指用体力或机械的力举起或抬起某物。

sentence.Network_en: Here's an inside tip: The faster you rise, the harder you fall.
sentence.Network_cn: 给你一个小忠告：爬得越快，摔得越疼。

sentence.Network_en: There are intangible benefits beyond a rise in the share price.
sentence.Network_cn: 除股价上升之外还有无形利益。

sentence.Network_en: Once wholesale prices are deregulated, consumer prices will also rise.
sentence.Network_cn: 一旦批发价格放开，零售价格也会随之上涨。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English rīsan 'make an attack', 'wake, get out of bed', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch rijzen and German reisen

encyclopedia.content: 同名专辑1 中文名称：Rise 资源类型：MP3! 版本：特别加长版并附赠mv一枚 发行时间：2001年09月19日 专辑歌手：Gabrielle 地区：英国 语言：英语 简介： Gabrielle这位英国女歌手被国内的音乐迷熟知只要是因为《bj单身日记》中她的那首out of reach。 但是其实在英国，她是一位家喻户晓的灵魂音乐大师。虽然出道时间不长，但是却得到了英国音乐奖最佳女歌手等诸多奖项的肯定。 此张专辑是她2000年发表的专辑《rise》的特别加长版

entry.def: If something rises, it moves upwards.

example.ex: He watched the smoke rise from his cigarette...
example.tran: 他注视着烟雾从香烟上升起。

example.ex: The powdery dust rose in a cloud around him.
example.tran: 一团粉尘在他周围扬起。

entry.def: When you rise, you stand up.

example.ex: Luther rose slowly from the chair...
example.tran: 卢瑟慢慢地从椅子上站起来。

example.ex: He looked at Livy and Mark, who had risen to greet him.
example.tran: 他看着站起来跟他打招呼的莉薇和马克。

entry.def: When you rise, you get out of bed.

example.ex: Tony had risen early and gone to the cottage to work.
example.tran: 托尼很早就起来去小屋干活了。

entry.def: When the sun or moon rises, it appears in the sky.

example.ex: He wanted to be over the line of the ridge before the sun had risen.
example.tran: 他想在太阳升起以前翻过山脊。

entry.def: You can say that something rises when it appears as a large tall shape.

example.ex: The building rose before him, tall and stately...
example.tran: 那座高大宏伟的建筑耸立在他面前。

example.ex: The towers rise out of a concrete podium.
example.tran: 这些塔楼耸立在一个混凝土墩座上。

entry.def: If the level of something such as the water in a river rises, it becomes higher.

example.ex: The waters continue to rise as more than 1,000 people are evacuated.
example.tran: 水面持续上涨，已经有1,000多人被疏散了。

example.ex: ...the tides rise and fall.
example.tran: 潮水时涨时落。

entry.def: If land rises, it slopes upwards.

example.ex: He looked up the slope of land that rose from the house...
example.tran: 他抬头看了看屋后的斜坡。

example.ex: The ground begins to rise some 20 yards away...
example.tran: 地面在20码开外的地方开始升高。

entry.def: A rise is an area of ground that slopes upwards.

example.ex: The pub itself was on a rise, commanding views across the countryside...
example.tran: 酒吧本身就建在一个斜坡上，可以俯眺乡村风光。

example.ex: I climbed to the top of a rise overlooking the ramparts.
example.tran: 我爬到了一个可以俯瞰护城墙的坡顶。

entry.def: If an amount rises, it increases.

example.ex: Pre-tax profits rose from £842,000 to £1.82m...
example.tran: 税前利润从84.2万英镑上升到了182万英镑。

example.ex: Tourist trips of all kinds in Britain rose by 10.5% between 1977 and 1987...
example.tran: 英国各种旅游项目在1977至1987年间增多了10.5%。

entry.def: A rise in the amount of something is an increase in it.

example.ex: ...the prospect of another rise in interest rates...
example.tran: 利率可能会再次上涨

example.ex: Foreign nationals have begun leaving because of a sharp rise in violence.
example.tran: 因为暴力活动的急剧增加，外国人已经开始离开这个国家。

entry.def: A rise is an increase in your wages or your salary.

example.ex: He will get a pay rise of nearly £4,000.
example.tran: 他的工资将会上涨将近4,000英镑。

entry.tran: (运动或活动的)兴起,抬头，高涨
entry.def: The rise of a movement or activity is an increase in its popularity or influence.

example.ex: ...the rise of racism in America.
example.tran: 美国种族主义的抬头

example.ex: ...the rise of home ownership.
example.tran: 购房者的增多

entry.def: If the wind rises, it becomes stronger.

example.ex: The wind was still rising, approach-ing a force nine gale.
example.tran: 风力仍在增强，接近9级大风。

entry.def: If a sound rises or if someone's voice rises, it becomes louder or higher.

example.ex: 'Bernard?' Her voice rose hysterically...
example.tran: “伯纳德？”她歇斯底里地提高了嗓门。

example.ex: His voice rose almost to a scream.
example.tran: 他提高了嗓门，几乎在尖叫。

entry.def: If a sound rises from a group of people, it comes from them.

example.ex: There were low, muffled voices rising from the hallway.
example.tran: 从走廊里隐约传来了低沉的说话声。

entry.def: If an emotion rises in someone, they suddenly feel it very intensely so that it affects their behaviour.

example.ex: A tide of emotion rose and clouded his judgement...
example.tran: 心头涌起一阵强烈的感情，模糊了他的判断力。

example.ex: The thought made anger rise in him and he went into a bar and had a double whisky.
example.tran: 这个想法让他怒火直冒，于是他去了一家酒吧，要了双份的威士忌。

entry.tran: (因为生气、尴尬或兴奋)脸红，涨红脸
entry.def: If your colour rises or if a blush rises in your cheeks, you turn red because you feel angry, embarrassed, or excited.

example.ex: Amy felt the colour rising in her cheeks at the thought.
example.tran: 埃米一想到这件事，就觉得脸红。

entry.def: When the people in a country rise, they try to defeat the government or army that is controlling them.

example.ex: The National Convention has promised armed support to any people who wish to rise against armed oppression.
example.tran: 国民议会承诺向所有想要反抗武装压迫的人提供武装支持。

entry.tran: 升职;升迁;地位提高;变得更成功
entry.def: If someone rises to a higher position or status, they become more important, successful, or powerful.

example.ex: She is a strong woman who has risen to the top of a deeply sexist organisation...
example.tran: 她是一个女强人，已经升至一个性别歧视意识根深蒂固的组织的最高层。

example.ex: From an unlikely background he has risen rapidly through the ranks of government.
example.tran: 虽然没有什么背景，但他在政府中的地位仍然迅速提高。

entry.tran: 升迁;日益成功;地位的提高
entry.def: The rise of someone is the process by which they become more important, successful, or powerful.

example.ex: Haig's rise was fuelled by an all-consuming sense of patriotic duty...
example.tran: 黑格非常强烈的爱国主义责任感使他的地位大大提高了。

example.ex: The group celebrated the regime's rise to power in 1979.
example.tran: 这个集团庆祝该政府于1979年上台执政。

entry.def: If something gives rise to an event or situation, it causes that event or situation to happen.

example.ex: Low levels of choline in the body can give rise to high blood-pressure...
example.tran: 体内胆碱水平过低会引起高血压。

example.ex: The picture gave rise to speculation that the three were still alive and being held captive.
example.tran: 这张照片让人们猜测这3个人还活着，而且被囚禁起来了。

means.word_mean: 1. a growth in strength or number or importance
2. the act of changing location in an upward direction
3. an upward slope or grade (as in a road);

sentences.sentence: "the car couldn't make it up the rise"
"they cheered the rise of the hot-air balloon"

means.word_mean: 5. the amount a salary is increased;
6. the property possessed by a slope or surface that rises
7. a wave that lifts the surface of the water or ground
8. (theology) the origination of the Holy Spirit at Pentecost;

sentences.sentence: "the doctrine of the procession of the Holy Spirit from the Father and the Son"
"they asked for a 10% rise in rates"
"the news caused a general advance on the stock market"
"The smoke arose from the forest fire"

means.word_mean: 2. increase in value or to a higher point;

sentences.sentence: "the value of our house rose sharply last year"

means.word_mean: 7. come into existence; take on form or shape;

sentences.sentence: "A new religious movement originated in that country"
"a love that sprang up from friendship"
"the idea for the book grew out of a short story"

means.word_mean: 8. be promoted, move to a better position

sentences.sentence: "Sales were climbing after prices were lowered"

means.word_mean: 10. get up and out of bed;

sentences.sentence: "I get up at 7 A.M. every day"
"Her new novel jumped high on the bestseller list"
"the dough rose slowly in the warm room"
"Her spirits rose when she heard the good news"

means.word_mean: 14. exert oneself to meet a challenge;
15. take part in a rebellion; renounce a former allegiance

sentences.sentence: "The sun uprising sees the dusk night fled..."

auth_sentence.content: It fails to rise above its dated britpop roots.
auth_sentence.res_content: It fails to rise above its dated britpop roots.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It fails to rise above its dated britpop roots.

auth_sentence.content: Injury has slowed Lawes' rise through international rugby.
auth_sentence.res_content: Injury has slowed Lawes' rise through international rugby.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Injury has slowed Lawes' rise through international rugby.

auth_sentence.content: Their nesting patterns gave rise to the term rookery.
auth_sentence.res_content: Their nesting patterns gave rise to the term rookery.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Their nesting patterns gave rise to the term rookery.

stems_affixes.word_buile: risib=risible[adj.可笑的,引人发笑的]+ility→n.爱笑,幽默感

stems_affixes.value_cn: 上升, 增加, 上涨
stems_affixes.word_buile: ris升起,唤醒+e→n.&v.上升, 增加, 上涨

stems_affixes.value_cn: 出现, 发生, 起因于
stems_affixes.word_buile: a+rise[n.&v.上升, 增加, 上涨]→v.出现, 发生, 起因于

abbreviation.mean_cn: 被挑选出来的可靠性得到改进的设备
可重复使用的充气式营救设备

Sentence.sentence: Likewise, theimpactof this warming will be very different depending on where you are—coastal areas must worry about rising sea levels, while Siberia and northern Canada may become more habitable (宜居的) andappealingfor humans than these areas are now.

Although Kodak anticipated the inevitable rise of digital photography, its corporate（企业的） culture was too rooted in the successes of the past for it to make the clean break necessary to fully embrace the future.

Given the rising investment in college education, parental concern is not surprising, but learning where and when to intervene (干预 ) will help students take more ownership of the outcomes of these increasingly costly educations.

Some scientists believe that the rise in carbon levels means that the Amazon and other rain forests in Asia and Africa may go from being assets in the battle against rising temperatures to liabilities.

Some scientists believe that the rise in carbon levels means that the Amazon and other rain forests in Asia and Africa may go from being assets in the battle against rising temperatures to liabilities.
The author argues that the rising carbon levels in rain forests may turn them into a major source of greenhouse gases

means.word_mean: 升高, 上升; 上涨, 增高

sentences.en: She rose to greet her guests.
She rises early in the morning.
At last the people rose up in arms and defeated the cruel rulers.
sentences.cn: 人民终于武装起义推翻了残暴的统治者。

means.word_mean: 休会；闭会；散会；(饭后)离席

sentences.en: The conference will now rise for dinner.
sentences.cn: 现在会议将休会去吃饭。

sentences.en: The wind rose suddenly in the afternoon.
Fear caused his hair to rise.
sentences.cn: 恐惧使他的毛发竖立起来。

sentences.en: A high pagoda rises behind our house.
sentences.cn: 在我们家的后面矗立着一座高塔。

sentences.en: Can a man rise from the grave?
sentences.cn: 人能从坟墓中死而复生吗?
吵架常常是由一些鸡毛蒜皮的小事而引起的。

means.word_mean: (数量、价格、价值等的)增长；增加

sentences.en: The increase of wages is proportional to the rise in prices.
sentences.cn: 工资的增长与物价的上涨是成比例的。

sentences.en: The rise of computer technology has transformed industry.
sentences.cn: 计算机技术的兴起已经使工业为之改观。

sentences.en: The boy ran ahead to rise the sparrows.
sentences.cn: 小男孩朝前奔去把麻雀轰跑了。

jushi.english: We sat at the top of a small rise.
The rise in lung cancer was a consequence of cigarette smoking.
jushi.chinese: 肺癌的增加是吸烟的结果。

jushi.english: High unemployment is not necessarily linked with the rise in prices.
jushi.chinese: 失业率高与物价上涨不一定有联系。
